qas.question: In what type of network are most scientific research studies conducted in Portugal?

answers.text: R&D units belonging to public universities and state-managed autonomous research institutions

qas.question: What is one example of a state-managed autonomous research institution?

answers.text: INETI – Instituto Nacional de Engenharia, Tecnologia e Inovação

qas.question: By which ministry is authority granted for funding and managing Portugal's research system?

answers.text: Ministry of Science, Technology and Higher Education (MCTES)

context: Scientific and technological research activities in Portugal are mainly conducted within a network of <a0_0>R&D units belonging to public universities and state-managed autonomous research institutions<a0_0/> like the <a1_0>INETI – Instituto Nacional de Engenharia, Tecnologia e Inovação<a1_0/> and the INRB – Instituto Nacional dos Recursos Biológicos. The funding and management of this research system is mainly conducted under the authority of the <a2_0>Ministry of Science, Technology and Higher Education (MCTES)<a2_0/> itself and the MCTES's Fundação para a Ciência e Tecnologia (FCT). The largest R&D units of the public universities by volume of research grants and peer-reviewed publications, include biosciences research institutions like the Instituto de Medicina Molecular, the Centre for Neuroscience and Cell Biology, the IPATIMUP, the Instituto de Biologia Molecular e Celular and the Abel Salazar Biomedical Sciences Institute.
